title: Why are my parents not allowing me to go to a co-ed college? - Quora

response.answer_text: It seems from the wording of the question that you want to go to a co-ed school. I suspect if you could demonstrate that the co-ed school you want to go to has a superior academic program compared to the non-co-ed school your parents have in mind that you might be able to win them over. I expect this approach will be more successful than just saying you are super excited about mixing with the opposite sex during your puberty years at a co-ed school.

From the beginning of my 1st standard I always went to the co-ed. Co-ed system always provide you the competition situation as you compete both the girls as well as boys. This type of education system groom you for the world. I completed my 12 this year in a very well known school of Delhi. I passed out from a co-ed school. Now I took admission in DUnbut my father told me that take admission in girls College because as you are a girl and your safety is more important ,we can't take any risk. What the hell man I was girl since I born then why you allowed me to study in a co-ed school. If anything wrong was going to be happened with me it can be anywhere, anytime or in any phase of my life .WHY GIRLS COLLEGE NOW🤔🤔😓
